p: Although JE has been a notifiable disease in China since the 1950s, for many years only aggregate data on JE incidence were submitted to the countryâ€™s province level. In 2005, China began to implement a National Notifiable Disease Reporting System (NNDRS), that permitted surveillance data to flow from hospitals and county-level Centers for Disease Control (CDC) to the national CDC, through a web-based computerized reporting system [ 18]. The National JE Surveillance Guideline was then issued in 2006 and recommended that case-based JE surveillance be conducted throughout the country.
